headline: Hartford profit falls as California wildfire losses climb
summary: The California fires, one of the costliest natural disasters in American history, are estimated to have caused economic losses running up to $250 billion, dealing a major blow to insurers' earnings.  Natural disasters have had a major effect on insurers, especially as the frequency of catastrophic weather-related incidents have increased.  Hartford said that its property and casualty (P&C) current accident year catastrophe losses came in at $467 million, before tax, for the quarter.

headline: The Hartford Announces First Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: HARTFORD, Conn., April 24, 2025--The Hartford (NYSE: HIG) today announced financial results for the first quarter ended March 31, 2025.
